I've been using ffnet, and am new to NEAT 
Well in fact i'm new to neural n=
ets, i dont have a special math degree.
But i carry a netbook with python a=
nd am not afraid to use it. 

My first attempt was to train a net to optimi=
ze a photo reduce noise, or basicly any improved photo it should learn.. bu=
t it turned out it was working but the net wasnt that good in learning, noi=
se reduction can be done better with statistics i know believe. still ffnet=
 was fun.
Although extreme fast it couldnt do all, all neurons had to go in=
 one forward direction, loops where not allowed.

So beeing new to this i w=
ondered maybe there are some more python enthusiasts here, who tried that w=
ith some small programs.
I hope someone combined it with pygame, if so i re=
al like to see it

Also if someone knows of some readable intro to this mat=
er, cause my experience and understanding end around a XOR problem and a hu=
ge net of 3 times a 81 nodes layer network (which i made).

I've heard some=
thing about non optimized nets, that cann still do wel
i think that might b=
e nice, but have not found it sofar would be nice too.
